title: What is it!!!
content:
Hi all!

I was wondering if you could help, I need to know what this typeface is!  
Sorry for the large image!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828215411im_/http:/typophile.com/files/photo_3631.JPG)
author: Sweet_Nothings

comments.content:
Heavy editing of a Didone or Bodini. A region in the middle of the font is extremely stretched to create vertical strokes -- angled for the s -- and what was probably a ball terminal on the a is amputated.  
Don't know if its worth seeking out the precise victim of this surgery.  
Easy to see version of your image:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828215411im_/http:/typophile.com/files/StretchCut_3527.jpg)
  
Don

Reminds me of [Spire](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828215411/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/grouptype/spire) but that's not it. I guess reworking something like [Abraham Lincoln](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828215411/http:/www.losttype.com/font/?name=Abraham%20Lincoln) the way suggested by Don could get you pretty close.

I gave up after trying to find a high contrast font having an a with the center stroke tapering upward into the rhs stem, a c with an upward spur, an e with a sloped crossbar, and Didot style serifs for stems.  
But I still wonder who did this combination.  
Don
